timeline.bodyText:
it does no longer be need to be legal for legacyRules to be empty when the test is true.
if i just want to have disabling a rule, i should use Rule#isEnabled for that)
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: The goal is (and has always been) to be able to use this to migrate from legacy rules to new ones. When new rules are enabled, the legacy ones should be disabled (and vice-versa).
replies.author: martint

timeline.bodyText: legacyRulesPreferred would better reflect the semantics.
timeline.author: kasiafi

replies.bodyText: I'll change it to useLegacyRules. It's not really a preference. It's a binary choice.
replies.author: martint

replies.bodyText:
Yes, from the perspective of the caller it is binary, as they provide legacy rules.
From the perspective of implementation, it is a preference, because this toggle is ignored if legacy rules is empty.
I meant the implementation perspective, but it is more important how it shows to the caller.
replies.author: kasiafi

timeline.bodyText: Rename this class to TestSetFlatteningRules or so.
timeline.author: kasiafi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -134,8 +138,12 @@ protected void assertPlan(String sql, PlanMatchPattern pattern)
                         new RuleStatsRecorder(),
                         getQueryRunner().getStatsCalculator(),
                         getQueryRunner().getEstimatedExchangesCostCalculator(),
-                        ImmutableSet.of(new RemoveRedundantIdentityProjections())),
-                new SetFlatteningOptimizer());

timeline.message:
Remove config and session property to toggle iterative optimizer

There are not rules that currently depend on it.  Going forward,
specific instance of IterativeOptimizer can be turned on or off
with dedicated config options for the specific set of rules being
migrated:

    new IterativeOptimizer(
        ...,
        session -> <predicate to check whether legacy rules should be enabled>,
        <legacy rules>,
        <new rules>)

timeline.author: kasiafi

timeline.message:
Remove legacy ImplementIntersectAndExceptAsUnion

The new rules have been around for a while and shown to work well.

Remove legacy SetFlatteningOptimizer

The new rules have been around for a while and show to work well.

timeline.bodyText: Is there a way to set this useLegacy session rules and pass the legacy rule ?
timeline.author: Praveen2112

replies.bodyText: Not directly. This is callsite specific. For instance, you might create a new set of rules with a new session property to enable/disable the legacy rule just for that optimization, and in the instantiation of the IterativeOptimizer you'd pass a predicate that knows how to check whether that session is set.
replies.author: martint
